item.title: Stalker 2: Should You Shoot Or Knock Out Solder?
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Should You Shoot Solder or Knock Him Out in Stalker 2?

Solder almost felt like the main villain in the story of Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl , as a good chunk of early gameplay is focused on tracking him down. However, to the players' surprise, they locate Solder early on to finally confront him about the blunder, whether he betrayed Skiff in the beginning or not.

After a brief struggle, you'll be presented with a choice to either end Solder's life or spare it . Even though the repercussions of your choice won't be immediately apparent, they have a big impact on the story down the line.

Should You Shoot Solder or Knock Him Out in Stalker 2?

Players will be able to confront Solder at the end of the "Behind Seven Seals" main mission in Stalker 2 . You'll get to this point after asking about Solder around Zalissya, finding Squint, and retrieving Ward Sensors. Lastly, players must decide whether to hand over the Sensors to either Captain Zotov or Richter before infiltrating the Sphere.

No matter the choices you made before, it will ultimately lead to a confrontation with Solder that will have players choose whether to shoot Solder or knock him out. This is a timed choice, and players will need to make up their minds quickly. Shooting Solder might seem like the obvious thing to do, considering his scam in the beginning. However, he did explain that his job entails only marking anomalies on the map, and the intel mix-up in the beginning wasn't intentional.

So it's up to the players to either believe his words and spare him or simply shoot him up. Regardless, here are the non-spoiler and spoiler versions of the consequences of shooting or knocking out Solder in Stalker 2 .

Shoot or Knock Out Solder (Non-Spoiler Version)

Shoot Solder

  • After killing Solder, players can loot his body.
  • He won't appear in a mid-game mission to assist Skiff, making it even harder to complete it.
  • Players will see his soul in a mid-game main mission, which leads to one of the endings for Stalker 2.

Knock Out Solder

  • Players can't loot Solder's body after knocking him out.
  • Solder will show up during a mid-game mission and assist Skiff, allowing him to complete it easily.

Spoilers for the missions leading to the ending of Stalker 2 are below.

Shoot or Knock Out Solder (Spoiler Version)

Shoot Solder

  • Killing Solder allows players to loot his body and find a PDA device with a brief message.
  • Solder will not show up to assist players during the "Hornet's Nest" main mission to disable the PSI Emitter.
  • Players will see his soul in the "Through The Valley Of The Shadow Of Death" main mission, which leads to the Spark faction ending.

Knock Out Solder

  • Players can't loot Solder's body after knocking him out.
  • Solder will help Skiff cut power to the PSI Emitter during the "Hornet's Nest," making it much easier to complete the mission.

So, keeping the fact that Solder didn't intentionally sell Skiff the wrong coordinates and that he plays a somewhat major role down the line, it's recommended to simply Knock Solder out in Stalker 2 . However, the decision is totally up to the players, as hardcore fans might be willing to experience both outcomes in multiple playthroughs.

item.title: EA Sports FC 25 Reveals Black Friday 2024 Plans
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Standard and Ultimate Editions of EA Sports FC 25 are 50% off during the Black Friday sale.
  • Retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, and GameStop offer substantial discounts on physical copies of the game.

EA has revealed its Black Friday 2024 plans for EA Sports FC 25 , including major discounts for the Standard Edition and Ultimate Edition. The Black Friday sale gives gamers the perfect opportunity to get into EA Sports FC 25 this holiday season before new updates arrive.

Released on September 27, EA Sports FC 25 brings back the signature Ultimate Team mode, Clubs, and Kick-Off, along with the introduction of the new 5v5 Rush mode. In 5v5 Rush, up to three friends can team up per squad, with each player controlling their favorite Player Item. The developers also improved the returning Manager and Player Career modes to let players relive the biggest storylines and moments from real-world leagues, including the top five women's football leagues. New title updates are on the way for EA Sports FC 25 , and players can dive right in this week while saving money, thanks to the game's biggest discount yet.

The EA Sports FC 25 Black Friday sale is now live across digital storefronts on all platforms and retailers until December 4. In the US, gamers can save up to 50% off on the digital Standard Edition of EA Sports FC 25 , bringing the price down to $29.99 on the Nintendo Switch eShop and $34.99 on PlayStation Store, Microsoft Store, and Steam. The Ultimate Edition is also 50% off ($49.99) on the Microsoft Store, so Xbox gamers have the opportunity to gain a big head-start on Ultimate Team with this edition's bonus of 4600 FC Points. It's worth noting that the discounts will vary by region, however.

EA Sports FC 25 Black Friday Sale is Live Until December 4

  • Digital Standard Edition is 50% off on Nintendo eShop, PlayStation Store, Microsoft Store, and Steam.
  • Physical Standard Edition is up to $40 off at Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart.
  • GameStop and Microsoft Store offer a 50% discount on the Ultimate Edition.

At retail, gamers in the US can save up to $40 on the physical EA Sports FC 25 Standard Edition at Best Buy and Walmart, thanks to their respective Black Friday sales. Amazon is also offering the same $40 discount on the EA Sports FC 25 Standard Edition for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S. What's more, GameStop is offering a 50% discount on the EA Sports FC 25 Ultimate Edition, which is reduced even further to $47.49 for GameStop Pro members. Retail discounts may vary by store and region, so gamers may want to check listings per local store.

EA plans to introduce holiday updates for EA Sports FC 25 , so new and returning players have more content to look forward to as 2024 comes to a close. Previous EA Sports FC 25 updates brought nerfs and balance changes to all versions of the game, including reduced accuracy for First Time Lobbed Through Passes. It's unclear what the next update will entail, but EA will likely share more details on what's to come after the Black Friday sale ends.

item.title: Towers of Aghasba: How to Get Leather
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Get Leather In Towers Of Aghasba
  • What Can You Craft With Leather In Towers of Aghasba?

Towers of Aghasba is proving to be quite a complex game for a survival builder, with lots of activities to complete and dozens of resources to gather before players can reach the end game. And Leather is one of those scarce products that players might be wondering where to find. So, if players have reached this guide, they probably wondered how and where Leather is obtained in the game.

Where To Get Leather In Towers Of Aghasba

To get Leather in Towers Of Aghasba, players will need to use the Tailor station. But to unlock this workbench, they have to complete a series of quests first. Here's what players need to do to get the Tailor Station:

  1. Repair the Lutoro Bridge.
  2. Reach Midhaven and Talk to the Forest God.
  3. Plant the Tropical Ecosystem King Seed.
  4. Start the Great Midhaven Restoration Project by talking to Ajit.
  5. Build the Lumbermill in Midhaven.
  6. Build the Alchemist.
  7. Finally, unlock the Tailor and build it using Hide, Tree Bark, and Resin.

Now players will get access to several things, starting with Leather crafting . Players can craft leather using 2x ropes, 3x hides, and 1x resin , yielding 2 units of leather.

Hide can be obtained by hunting most animals around Template and Tropical Ecosystem, but watch out for Amity expenditure since it drops really fast without notice. Resin can be obtained by Resin Fir Trees, and Resin Pools, which pop up in Template Ecosystem.

There's a slight chance to get Resin from regular trees every time players chop them down. Remember that using makeshift Stone tools will have less chances than using superior tools like the Iron Hatchet, for example. Rope is the easiest to obtain, and it is hand-crafted using 2xFiber. Fiber is picked nearly all around the islands from Weeds, Bushes, and most Plants.

What Can You Craft With Leather In Towers of Aghasba?

Players will get access to advanced crafting when completing Tier 2 of the Midhaven Restoration Project, and by building the Blacksmith, they will have access to advanced gathering tools crafted with Wood, Iron, and Leather.

There are also Decoration Items, Houses, and Other Cultural Point structures that can be crafted using Leather, and this will be unlocked as players restore Shrines and regions of the Islands.

Keep in mind that amassing Cultural Points is necessary to restore each Village and increase their Tier, so players will have to invest quite some time doing landscaping.

item.title: December 14 is Going to Be a Big Day for Pokemon GO Players
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Necrozma and its fusions return in a Raid Day event on December 14 from 2-5 pm local time.
  • Fusions require specific candy and energy, no cost to undo, with unique Adventure Effects.

Pokemon GO has announced that Necrozma and its fusions will return in a new Raid Day on December 14. This will be one of the first events of the next Pokemon GO season, giving players the chance to get some strong Pokemon that Niantic added this year.

Necrozma appeared for the first time during Pokemon GO Fest 2024 as a Special Research reward for players of the in-person events and in raids for trainers around the world. But that wasn't the only big news, as the devs confirmed the debut of Necrozma fusions in Pokemon GO , with Dusk Mane and Dawn Wings Necrozma becoming available during the GO Fest. And now, devs have big news related to them.

Necrozma and its fusions will return to Pokemon GO on the upcoming Raid Day on December 14 from 2 pm to 5 pm local time. Dusk Mane Necrozma and Dawn Wings Necrozma will appear more frequently in raids, and defeating them will give trainers a chance to catch Necrozma. From December 13-14, from 5 pm to 8 pm PST, the Remote Raid Pass limit will be 20, and players will receive up to five additional Raid Passes by spinning PokeStops. For $5, a ticket will be available, allowing them to get more Raid Passes, XP, Stardust, and a chance to earn Candy XL. The game's online store will sell an Ultra Box for $4.99 with an event ticket and a Premium Battle Pass.

Pokemon GO Announces Raid Day Featuring Dusk Mane and Dawn Wings Necrozma

  • When: Saturday, December 14, 2024, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time
  • Returning Pokemon: Necrozma, Dusk Mane Necrozma (via fusion), Dawn Wings Necrozma (via fusion)
  • New event ticket available for $5
  • New Ultra Box available on the Pokemon GO Web Store for $4.99
  • Dusk Mane Necrozma and Dawn Wings Necrozma will have access to Adventure Effects to attract Day and Night Pokemon.

Daytime Pokemon

  • Pidgey
  • Alolan Exeggutor
  • Solrock
  • Cottonee
  • Helioptile
  • Tyrunt
  • Yungoos
  • Rockruff
  • Fomantis

Nighttime Pokemon

  • Alolan Rattata
  • Clefairy
  • Alolan Marowak
  • Hoothoot
  • Galarian Zigzagoon
  • Lunatone
  • Munna
  • Amaura
  • Rockruff

With the return of the Legendary Pokemon of Alola and its fusions, the previous mechanics will also be back. Thus, players who get Necrozma on Raid Day will need 1000 Solar Fusion Energy and 30 Necrozma and Cosmog Candy to fuse it with Solgaleo, and 1000 Lunar Fusion Energy and 30 Necrozma and Cosmoy Candy to fuse it with Lunala. There will be no energy or candy cost to undo the fusions. Each fusion will have an Adventure Effect, with Sunsteel Strike (Dusk Mane Nerozma) attracting daytime Pokemon, and Moongeist Bean (Dawn Wings Necrozma) attracting nighttime critters.

After revealing the title and dates, Niantic has revealed more details about Pokemon GO 's Dual Destiny season. One of the main novelties is the return of Hoopa, something Pokemon GO had previously teased, with the Mythical Pokemon returning to the game after its debut in 2021. During the new season, which ends in March 2025, trainers will see the debuts of Sinistea and Polteageist, new Shadow Raids, and more.

item.title: Halls Of Torment: Best Blessings, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Blessings in Halls of Torment, such as Health Capacity, Crit Bonus, and Effect on Hit Chance, improve player performance.
  • Certain must-have Blessings boost overall Health, crit damage, and chances of proccing status effects.
  • Halls of Torment offers strategic Blessings like Multistrike, Movement Speed, and Attack Speed to enhance gameplay.

Set in the hellish landscape of the eponymous Halls of Torment, players of Halls of Torment create characters and enter environments reminiscent of those in 90s RPGs. There, they must defeat opponents using a myriad of weapons and special abilities. Chief among those abilities is the various Blessings that improve a player’s performance.

However, there are many Blessings at the player’s disposal in a single playthrough. With all the options available, gamers may have a hard time selecting the best ones for their particular setups. The following Blessings in Halls of Torment are considered must-haves in any run.

Updated November 26, 2024 by Rhenn Taguiam: With Halls of Torment having reached its million sales milestone last October 17, 2024, the top-down horde survival game gives players a fast-and-loose take on popular 90s RPGs with the ability to select a hero, descend into the levels of Hell, and tear through packs of demons while improving their abilities.

And while players eagerly eliminate the Lords of Hell as they wait for a Halls of Torment upgrade, they may want to make sure their characters are suitably upgraded with the right Blessings. Among must-haves for players are Blessings that boost their overall Health, the damage they deal on crit, and having a better chance of proccing a status effect when hitting foes.

14 Health Capacity

Avoid Getting Overwhelmed With Higher Durability

  • Upgrade Costs: 400, 1200, 2400, 4000, 6000

Players who need a bit of extra durability in their Halls of Torment gameplay will appreciate the added benefit of Health Capacity , as every rank added into this Blessing will grant players +10% Health.

While this might seem a bit “small” for players, the added Health guarantees that players can take a lot more damage from enemies - a useful buff to have in higher levels where mobs and bosses can often take down players in just a few hits. Players gearing up for tanky builds could use Health Capacity as one of their defensive priorities. However, it’s not advisable to get Health Capacity at the onset, as players could use more buffs to their DPS given the game’s action-heavy nature.

13 Crit Bonus

Get Beefed Up With Crit Damage

  • Upgrade Costs: 600, 1800, 3600, 6000, 9000

Fans who want to boost their damage potential should consider boosting their overall DPS with Crit Bonus , which increases by +6% per rank. This particular upgrade in Halls of Torment is a must-have for more damage-oriented players whose builds bank on building up as much firepower as possible throughout their playthrough.

Of course, Crit Bonus only works insofar as players can actually proc the crit in the first place, making Crit Bonus a viable tool to use only with crit-oriented builds. This Blessing works nicely with Crit Chance and Base Crit Chance - provided players manage to get their character up to a decent enough attack stat.

12 Effect On Hit Chance

Get The Most Out Of Hits

  • Upgrade Costs: 400, 1200, 2400, 4000, 6000

While gameplay in Halls of Torment emphasizes how players can enjoy just duking it out against the forces of hell with attacks that build their DPS in the CRPG, other tactical players may appreciate punishing foes with a wide array of effects - Affliction, Burn, Curse, Fragile, Frost, Slow, Spark, or Stun. While players may consider focusing on dishing as much damage as they can with these elemental, debuff, and special effects, the Effect on Hit Chance Blessing combines the debilitating punishments of these effects with the sheer devastation of ordinary hits.

Thanks to this Blessing, players now have more chances of instilling this effect per hit. Each rank of this Blessing provides a +6% Effect on Hit Change, allowing players to capitalize on setups that encourage on-hit effects - incentivizing heavy-hitting DPS builds.

11 Multistrike

Get More Attacks In A Single Hit

  • Upgrade Costs: 1000, 3000, 6000, 1000, 15000

Players who want to make the most out of their heavy-hitting Halls of Torment setups will likely want a build that gives them more bang for their buck - literally. When taken in the context of most action-heavy titles, Attack Speed should be the way to go to maximize damage - especially when this stat is almost always set up to help players score more attacks in a shorter amount of time. However, Halls of Torment upends this gameplay concept with Multistrike , a Blessing that gives +6% Multistrike per rank.

This Blessing essentially taps into the game’s Multistrike mechanic. Whereas Attack Speed allows players to score more hits in a limited amount of time, Multistrike increases the number of hits players can do with a single strike. Objectively speaking, Multistrike can get the most out of a certain timeframe for players, with the Blessing being compatible with Attack Speed in that a character can use the latter stat to get more Multistrikes in within a shorter amount of time.

10 Movement Speed

Move Much Faster

  • Upgrade Costs: 200, 900, 1900, 3200, 4800

When it comes to a bullet hell game like Halls of Torment , it’s important for players to know how to position their characters to avoid being overwhelmed. With the Movement Speed Blessing, dodging enemy hordes and retreating to safe ground temporarily can bridge the gap between life and death.

Players get a permanent 6% boost to their base movement speed each time they upgrade a level of Movement Speed. Unlike other Blessings, Movement Speed doesn’t have any prerequisites. This means players can choose Movement Speed as one of the immediate upgradeable Blessings as soon as they head to the Shrine.

9 Damage

Increase Overall Damage

  • Upgrade Costs: 800, 1800, 3100, 4700, 6600

In bullet hell games, lack of DPS can spell trouble in the long term when facing mobs, similar to an MMO. However, the Damage Blessing can grant enormous advantages to damage-reliant characters like the Swordsman, who can’t always depend on attack range and size.

With each upgrade of Damage, players get a 10% boost in overall attack damage dealt to enemies . This boost can circumvent the lack of range, as killing enemies with bigger numbers gives players more room to redirect attacks to other opponents, who are ordinarily unreachable. To unlock this Blessing, a Swordsman needs to complete the “Strong Arms” quest within “Story: Path of the Sword,” which requires them to secure the Strength 4 trait in a single run.

8 Duration

Boost The Duration Of Effects

  • Upgrade Costs: 400, 1200, 2300, 3700, 5400

Halls of Torment gives players access to special attacks in the form of abilities associated with their respective characters. Classified under Traits, these abilities let players unleash devastating attacks that can eliminate countless opponents quickly. With the Duration Blessing, players can extend the duration of these attacks and abilities.

Each level in Duration increases the duration of attacks and abilities by 6% . To unlock this Blessing, players need to complete the “Longliving” Quest under “Story: Demonic Pact” as a Warlock. To complete this quest, players need to acquire the Channeling 5 trait in a single match.

7 Attack Speed

Attack Much Faster

  • Upgrade Costs: 600, 1500, 2700, 4200, 6000

Being a bullet hell game, Halls of Torment players must strategically time their attacks to ensure they hit a lot of opponents in a single strike. With Attack Speed, players can get a much-needed boost in attack speed to strike enemies before they hit them in a manner similar to timing Charged Attacks in Pokemon GO .

Each upgrade in Attack Speed grants a 6% boost to the player’s base attack speed . This is extremely useful across any level in the game since players secure more DPS the faster they can unleash attacks. To unlock this, players need to complete the “Breathless” Quest under “Story: Swift as an Arrow,” which requires them to secure the Quick Hands 4 trait in a single run with the Archer.

6 Attack Range

Release Attacks Further

  • Upgrade Costs: 200, 900, 1900, 3200, 4800

Granted, even melee characters like the Swordsman have a longer cone-shaped attack range in Halls of Torment . Thanks to the Attack Range Blessing, melee-reliant classes like the Swordsman can hit more with every strike. Meanwhile, the likes of the Ranger and the Exterminator can attack bosses and elites before they pose a threat to players.

Each level in Attack Range adds a permanent 8% boost to all attacks and abilities that the players release on enemies. When combined with a boosted attack area or projectile size, this allows players to hit more opponents at a distance with just a few strikes. This Blessing doesn’t need any prior achievements to be unlocked.

5 Area/Projectile Size

Attack From A Bigger Vantage Point

  • Upgrade Costs: 400, 1200, 2300, 3700, 5400

Attacks and abilities in Halls of Torment can come in a wide variety of forms that affect enemies in different ways, similar to weapon choices in RPGs. With Area/Projectile Size, a player’s base attacks can reach more enemies.

Whenever players purchase Area/Projectile Size as an upgrade, they get an 8% boost to the size of their projectiles and AOE attacks. This can have a huge impact on the way players establish their playthroughs since the increased size of attacks means spreading more damage across multiple foes and being able to kill them much faster.

4 Pickup Range

Get Items Much Faster

  • Upgrade Costs: 200, 900, 1900, 3200, 4800

In Halls of Torment, characters have a range where items immediately go to them. With Pickup Range, players get a 20% boost to their base pickup range , meaning they don’t need to get as close to loot before it gets dragged into their inventory.

Although this doesn’t necessarily boost a player’s overall stats, Pickup Range gives players the advantage of getting life-saving items when overwhelmed with foes. Instead of going neck-deep into enemy territory to get loot, the increased Pickup Range can allow players to benefit from much-needed drops even at a distance.

3 Gold Gain

Earn More Throughout Playthroughs

  • Upgrade Costs: 1000, 2100, 3500, 5200, 7200

Since Gold is a necessary resource for all upgrades and purchases, it makes sense for Halls of Torment players to prioritize getting more money out of every encounter. This can help them unlock perks much faster in a manner similar to management sims. With the Gold Gain Blessing, players can get rich faster in every run.

Each rank in Gold Gain gives players a flat 10% boost in the amount of Gold they find . To unlock this Blessing, players need to complete the “Elite Slayer 1” Milestone. To do so, players of any class must kill 50 Elite enemies.

2 Health Regeneration

Always Get Health Back Up

  • Upgrade Costs: 600, 1500, 2700, 4200, 6000

When gameplay proves dangerous, players can simply run away and recover health slowly before diving in for another round of smiting. With the Health Regeneration Blessing, players can boost their odds of survival with stronger passive regen.

The Health Regeneration Blessing boosts health regen by +0.15/s for each level up . This means maxing out Health Regeneration gives players a permanent +0.75/s boost. This can be a big deal in the long term, considering a tanky character like the Swordsman can have 500 Max HP. Unlocking this Blessing is simple, as players simply need to unlock the “Thirsty” Milestone . To achieve this, players need to consume 10 Health Potions as any character.

1 Revives

Get One More Chance

  • Upgrade Costs: 5000, 25000

When players manage to kill one lord in their Halls of Torment playthrough, the game grants them the Milestones (Survivor 1) achievement. This unlocks the Revives Blessing which, when purchased, will allow players to revive once whenever they visit the Halls. Since each upgrade increases the revive opportunities by one, the upgrade’s maximum will allow players to revive twice in each gameplay session.

This opportunity to revive allows players to get much further in a playthrough. Considering the game’s increasingly difficult levels the longer players stay in the Halls, the option to continue gameplay after accidents or being overwhelmed by mobs can be more worthwhile compared to other buffs.
